metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9297 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The TIFFFetchNormalTag function in LibTiff 4.0.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via crafted TIFF_SETGET_C16ASCII or TIFF_SETGET_C32_ASCII tag values.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9297` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> poc in in maptools.org bug entry tyhicks> The fix for this issue introduced a regression that has been assigned CVE-2016-9448 mdeslaur> this will not be fixed in precise/esm

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
